title: How to Make a Hanging Clothes Hamper

steps.headline: Turn your shirt inside out and pin evenly or baste the bottom of the shirt closed, leaving about 1 and 1/2 inches of fabric.
Sew along the basted line or pins all the way down the shirt and tie off the ends of thread.
Cut off the sleeves where they are sewn to the shirt (right behind the seam).
steps.description: (Or start with a long-sleeved shirt,  and leave the sleeves on (skipping steps 3-5). Even easier project, and when you tie the sleeves together at the cuff, your clothes hamper has a handle/carrying strap!)

steps.headline: Pin the opening of each armhole closed
Sew the armholes shut and turn the shirt/hamper right side out.
Unbutton about 3 or 4 buttons and leave the shirt open.
Hang your new hamper on a strong hanger.
steps.description: Possibly a wooden one if you can find it. Hang in your closet and fill with dirty laundry.

text: Turn your shirt inside out and pin evenly or baste the bottom of the shirt closed, leaving about 1 and 1/2 inches of fabric. This is where you sew. Sew along the basted line or pins all the way down the shirt and tie off the ends of thread.  Cut off the sleeves where they are sewn to the shirt (right behind the seam). (Or start with a long-sleeved shirt,  and leave the sleeves on (skipping steps 3-5). Even easier project, and when you tie the sleeves together at the cuff, your clothes hamper has a handle/carrying strap!) Pin the opening of each armhole closed  Sew the armholes shut and turn the shirt/hamper right side out.  Unbutton about 3 or 4 buttons and leave the shirt open.  Hang your new hamper on a strong hanger. Possibly a wooden one if you can find it. Hang in your closet and fill with dirty laundry.
